name: $::name
desc: Returns: The name of the operation or query. For an operation, this is the name  prefixed with $ and used in the URL. For a query, this is the name used in the _query parameter when the query is called.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The name of the operation or query. For an operation, this is the name  prefixed with $ and used in the URL. For a query, this is the name used in the _query parameter when the query is called.

name: $definition
desc: Returns: Where the formal definition can be found. If a server references the base definition of an Operation (i.e. from the specification itself such as ```http://hl7.org/fhir/OperationDefinition/ValueSet-expand```), that means it supports the full capabilities of the operation - e.g. both GET and POST invocation.  If it only supports a subset, it must define its own custom [OperationDefinition](operationdefinition.html#) with a 'base' of the original OperationDefinition.  The custom definition would describe the specific subset of functionality supported.

pvardefs.name: pValue

name: $documentation
desc: Returns: Documentation that describes anything special about the operation behavior, possibly detailing different behavior for system, type and instance-level invocation of the operation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Documentation that describes anything special about the operation behavior, possibly detailing different behavior for system, type and instance-level invocation of the operation.
